Pierre Delacroix.Action: Introduces himself confidently as a television writer and showrunner, showing awareness of the media landscape and challenges of audience retention.
Hands Cheeba a ten dollar bill.
Greets Marie politely with 'Good morning.'
Arrives late to the staff meeting, tries to justify his tardiness.
Holds Sloan's arm as they walk and talks to her under his breath.
Accuses Sloan of not telling him about the staff meeting, questioning her usefulness.

Acknowledges Dunwitty's apology and explains he was not informed about the meeting in an honest manner.
Expresses discomfort with Dunwitty's use of a racial slur and requests he not use it in his presence.
Imagines physically assaulting Dunwitty after provocative language, reflecting intense internal anger.
Doesn't join in Dunwitty's laughter, showing discomfort and inability to respond to racially charged jokes.
Asks Dunwitty to not use a racially offensive word in his presence, showing moral confidence.
Imagines physically attacking Dunwitty in response to offensive language but does not actually act on it, indicating strong internal reaction but lack of real-world assertiveness.
Expresses resistance and discomfort toward creating stereotypical, offensive content for the show.
Responds defensively to accusations of being an 'oreo' or sell-out, showing frustration.

Insists on keeping Manray alive for his own purposes, showing awareness of his resources.

Deflects accusation of being ungrateful without hostility.

Screams at the top of his lungs in frustration.

Looks like he has seen a ghost and buries his face in his hands after watching the controversial show segment.
